functions.name: Identify
functions.description: The Identify Function assists in developing an organizational understanding to managing cybersecurity risk to systems, people, assets, data, and capabilities. Understanding the business context, the resources that support critical functions, and the related cybersecurity risks enables an organization to focus and prioritize its efforts, consistent with its risk management strategy and business needs.

functions.name: Protect
functions.description: The Protect Function outlines appropriate safeguards to ensure delivery of critical infrastructure services. The Protect Function supports the ability to limit or contain the impact of a potential cybersecurity event.

functions.name: Detect
functions.description: The Detect Function defines the appropriate activities to identify the occurrence of a cybersecurity event. The Detect Function enables timely discovery of cybersecurity events.

functions.name: Respond
functions.description: The Respond Function includes appropriate activities to take action regarding a detected cybersecurity incident. The Respond Function supports the ability to contain the impact of a potential cybersecurity incident.

functions.name: Recover
functions.description: The Recover Function identifies appropriate activities to maintain plans for resilience and to restore any capabilities or services that were impaired due to a cybersecurity incident. The Recover Function supports timely recovery to normal operations to reduce the impact from a cybersecurity incident.

categories.name: Asset Management
categories.description: The data, personnel, devices, systems, and facilities that enable the organization to achieve business purposes are identified and managed consistent with their relative importance to organizational objectives and the organization's risk strategy.

categories.name: Business Environment
categories.description: The organization's mission, ovjectives, stakeholders, and activities are understood and prioritized; this information is used to inform cybersecurit roles, responsibilities, and risk management decisions.

categories.name: Governance
categories.description: The policies, procedures, and processes to manage and monitor the organization's regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements are understood and inform the management of cybersecurity risk.

categories.name: Risk Assessment
categories.description: The organization understands the cybersecurity risk to organizational operations (including mission, functions, image, or reputation), organizational assets, and individuals.

categories.name: Risk Management
categories.description: The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions are established and used to support operational risk decisions.

categories.name: Supply Chain Risk Management
categories.description: The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions are established and used to support risk decisions associated with managing supply chain risk. The organization has established and implemented the processes to identify, assess and manage supply chain risks.

categories.name: Identity Management and Access Control
categories.description: Access to physical and logical assets and associated facilities is limited to authorized users, processes, and devices, and is managed consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions.

categories.name: Awareness and Training
categories.description: The organization’s personnel and partners are provided cybersecurity awareness education and are trained to perform their cybersecurityrelated duties and responsibilities consistent with related policies, procedures, and agreements.

categories.name: Data Security
categories.description: Information and records (data) are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information.

categories.name: Information Protection Processes and Procedures
categories.description: Security policies (that address purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, and coordination among organizational entities), processes, and procedures are maintained and used to manage protection of information systems and assets.

categories.name: Maintenance
categories.description: Maintenance and repairs of industrial control and information system components are performed consistent with policies and procedures.

categories.name: Protective Technology
categories.description: Technical security solutions are managed to ensure the security and resilience of systems and assets, consistent with related policies, procedures, and agreements.

categories.name: Anomalies and Events
categories.description: Anomalous activity is detected and the potential impact of events is understood.

categories.name: Security Continuous Monitoring
categories.description: The information system and assets are monitored to identify cybersecurity events and verify the effectiveness of protective measures.

categories.name: Detection Processes
categories.description: Detection processes and procedures are maintained and tested to ensure awareness of anomalous events.

categories.name: Response Planning
categories.description: Response processes and procedures are executed and maintained, to ensure response to detected cybersecurity incidents.

categories.name: Communications
categories.description: Response activities are coordinated with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. external support from law enforcement agencies).

categories.name: Analysis
categories.description: Analysis is conducted to ensure effective response and support recovery activities.

categories.name: Mitigation
categories.description: Activities are performed to prevent expansion of an event, mitigate its effects, and resolve the incident.

categories.name: Improvements
categories.description: Organizational response activities are improved by incorporating lessons learned from current and previous detection/response activities.

categories.name: Recovery Planning
categories.description: Recovery processes and procedures are executed and maintained to ensure restoration of systems or assets affected by cybersecurity incidents.

categories.name: Improvements
categories.description: Recovery planning and processes are improved by incorporating lessons learned into future activities.

categories.name: Communications
categories.description: Restoration activities are coordinated with internal and external parties (e.g. coordinating centers, Internet Service Providers, owners of attacking systems, victims, other CSIRTs, and vendors).

subcategories.description: Physical devices and systems within the organization are inventoried.
Software platforms and applications within the organization are inventoried.
Organizational communication and data flows are mapped.
informative_references: NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 4 AC-4, CA-3, CA-9, PL-8

subcategories.description: External information systems are catalogued.
Resources (e.g., hardware, devices, data, time, personnel, and software) are prioritized based on their classification, criticality, and business value.
informative_references: COBIT 5 APO03.03, APO03.04, APO12.01, BAI04.02, BAI09.02
NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 4 CP-2, RA-2, SA-14, SC-6

subcategories.description: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for the entire workforce and third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) are established.
informative_references: NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 4 CP-2, PS-7, PM-11

subcategories.description: The organization's role in the supply chain is identified and communicated.
The organization's place in critical infrastructure and its industry sector is identified and communicated.
Priorities for organizational mission, objectives, and activities are established and communicated.
Dependencies and critical functions for delivery of critical services are established.
informative_references: NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 4 CP-8, PE-9, PE-11, PM-8, SA-14

subcategories.description: Resilience requirements to support delivery of critical services are established for all operating states (e.g., under duress/attack, during recovery, normal operations).
informative_references: NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 4 CP-2, CP-11, SA-13, SA-14

subcategories.description: Organizational cybersecurity policy is established and communicated.
informative_references: NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 4 -1 controls from all security control families

subcategories.description: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities are coordinated and aligned with internal roles and external partners.
informative_references: NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 4 PS-7, PM-1, PM-2

subcategories.description: Legal and regulatory requirements regarding cybersecurity, including privacy and civil liberties obligations, are understood and managed.
informative_references: NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 4 -1 controls from all security control families

subcategories.description: Governance and risk management processes address cybersecurity risks.
informative_references: NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 4 SA-2, PM-3, PM-7, PM-9, PM-10, PM-11

subcategories.description: Asset vulnerabilities are identified and documented.

subcategories.description: Cyber threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources.

subcategories.description: Threats, both internal and external, are identified and documented.

subcategories.description: Potential business impacts and likelihoods are identified.
informative_references: NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 4 RA-2, RA-3, SA-14, PM9, PM-11

subcategories.description: Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to determine risk.

subcategories.description: Risk responses are identified and prioritized.
Risk management processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders.

subcategories.description: Organizational risk tolerance is determined and clearly expressed.
The organization’s determination of risk tolerance is informed by its role in critical infrastructure and sector specific risk analysis.

subcategories.description: Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, assessed, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders.
informative_references: NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 4 SA-9, SA-12, PM-9

subcategories.description: Suppliers and third party partners of information systems, components, and services are identified, prioritized, and assessed using a cyber supply chain risk assessment process.

subcategories.description: Contracts with suppliers and third-party partners are used to implement appropriate measures designed to meet the objectives of an organization’s cybersecurity program and Cyber Supply Chain Risk Management Plan.

NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 4 SA-9, SA-11, SA-12, PM9

subcategories.description: Suppliers and third-party partners are routinely assessed using audits, test results, or other forms of evaluations to confirm they are meeting their contractual obligations.

subcategories.description: Response and recovery planning and testing are conducted with suppliers and third-party providers.

subcategories.description: Identities and credentials are issued, managed, verified, revoked, and audited for authorized devices, users and processes.

The development and testing environment(s) are separate from the production environment.

A baseline configuration of information technology/industrial control systems is created and maintained incorporating security principles (e.g. concept of least functionality).

subcategories.description: Policy and regulations regarding the physical operating environment for organizational assets are met.

subcategories.description: Data is destroyed according to policy.
